{{Infobox_Disease | Name = Holocarboxylase synthetase deficiency | Image =
biotin structure.svg | Caption = Biotin | DiseasesDB = 32709 | ICD10 = | ICD9 =
| ICDO = | OMIM = 253270 | MedlinePlus = | eMedicineSubj = ped | eMedicineTopic
= 1020 | MeshID = D028922 | }}  'Holocarboxylase synthetase deficiency' is
an inherited metabolic disorder in which the body is unable to use the vitamin
biotin effectively. This disorder is classified as a multiple carboxylase
deficiency, a group of disorders characterized by impaired activity of certain
enzymes that depend on biotin. Symptoms are very similar to biotinidase
deficiency and treatment â large doses of biotin â is also the same.
categories: Vitamin, coenzyme, and cofactor metabolism disorders
